comments:
build 20011206

Core dumped when running Eclipse.  I was doing something really innocuous 
when it occurred (like trying to select a perspective from the perspective tool 
bar).  Attached core text.
Created an attachment (id=173)
core dump log
JDT doesn't look to be involved in the stack trace.
Moving to SWT
We have to track these down! It's unforgivable to be GP'ing on windows at this 
point. Note that this *was* on the IBM VM, so it is not a JDK-only issue.
I've gotten a few core dumps and random walkbacks since switching to 20011206.
They all happened in a debug IBM JRE (debugging SwtStyledTextUseCase). I'm 
running Eclipse on J9 and so far it hasn't crashed.
A lot of these happened after stepping through the progam when clicking on 
resume.
Three of them occured in GC.stringExtent two others in DefaultContent.getLine.
I also got two walkbacks in Menu when exiting the debugee (no VM GPF). One 
ArrayStoreException in Menu.getItems and the other I believe was a NPE.
Walkback when exiting debug session:
